clinical_study.brief_title: Alternations of Intestinal Microbiota and Health Impact in CKD
clinical_study.official_title: Alternations of Intestinal Microbiota and Health Impact in Chronic Kidney Disease (AIM-HI CKD): A Cohort Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Taipei Tzu Chi Hospital, Buddhist Tzu Chi Medical Foundation

clinical_study.source: Taipei Tzu Chi Hospital, Buddhist Tzu Chi Medical Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary pattern, gut microbiota and their interactions on clinical outcomes among patient with CKD stage 3-5.

secondary_outcome.description: the change of cognitive function or they development of dementia assessed by the Modified Mini-Mental Status Exam annually for 3 years

other_outcome.measure: change of lean body mass, measured by bioimpedance spectroscopy every 3 months for 2 years
other_outcome.description: the change of lean body mass

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with CKD stage 3-5 defined as eGFR <60 ml/min/1.73 m2 calculated with the use of the four-variable Modification of Diet in Renal Disease formula who have not yet on dialysis therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with active cancer
- Patients with liver cirrhosis
- Patients have taken antibiotics within three months before screening for inclusion.
- Patients with a cardiac pacemaker or metallic implants,
- Patients are amputees
- Pregnant women
- Patients with inherited renal diseases
